1.name: Meet Joe Black
1.description: Death, who takes the form of a young man, asks a media mogul to act as a guide to teach him about life on Earth, and in the process, he falls in love with his guide's daughter.

2.name: Saving Private Ryan
2.description: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

3.name: The Big Lebowski
3.description: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

4.name: American History X
4.description: A former neo-nazi skinhead tries to prevent his younger brother from going down the same wrong path that he did.

5.name: Ever After: A Cinderella Story
5.description: The Brothers Grimm arrive at the home of a wealthy Grande Dame who speaks of the many legends surrounding the fable of the cinder girl before telling the "true" story of her ancestor.

6.name: There's Something About Mary
6.description: A man gets a chance to meet up with his dream girl from high school, even though his date with her back then was a complete disaster.

7.name: Deep Impact
7.description: Unless a comet can be destroyed before colliding with Earth, only those allowed into shelters will survive. Which people will survive?

8.name: The Truman Show
8.description: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

9.name: Blade
9.description: A half-vampire, half-mortal man becomes a protector of the mortal race, while slaying evil vampires.

10.name: The Wedding Singer
10.description: Robbie, a singer, and Julia, a waitress, are both engaged, but to the wrong people. Fortune intervenes to help them discover each other.

11.name: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
11.description: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.

12.name: Mulan
12.description: To save her father from death in the army, a young maiden secretly goes in his place and becomes one of China's greatest heroines in the process.

13.name: The Man in the Iron Mask
13.description: The cruel King Louis XIV of France has a secret twin brother whom he keeps imprisoned. Can the twin be substituted for the real king?

14.name: The Thin Red Line
14.description: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.

15.name: Wild Things
15.description: A police detective uncovers a conspiracy behind a case involving a high-school guidance counselor when accusations of rape are made against him by two female students.

16.name: Rush Hour
16.description: A loyal and dedicated Hong Kong Inspector teams up with a reckless and loudmouthed L.A.P.D. detective to rescue the Chinese Consul's kidnapped daughter, while trying to arrest a dangerous crime lord along the way.

17.name: The Waterboy
17.description: A waterboy for a college football team discovers he has a unique tackling ability and becomes a member of the team.

18.name: Armageddon
18.description: After discovering that an asteroid the size of Texas is going to impact Earth in less than a month, N.A.S.A. recruits a misfit team of deep core drillers to save the planet.

19.name: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
19.description: An oddball journalist and his psychopathic lawyer travel to Las Vegas for a series of psychedelic escapades.

20.name: A Bug's Life
20.description: A misfit ant, looking for "warriors" to save his colony from greedy grasshoppers, recruits a group of bugs that turn out to be an inept circus troupe.

21.name: Six Days Seven Nights
21.description: Robin Monroe, a New York magazine editor, and the gruff pilot Quinn Harris must put aside their mutual dislike if they are to survive after crash landing on a deserted South Seas island.

22.name: Godzilla
22.description: A giant, reptilian monster surfaces, leaving destruction in its wake as it strides into New York City. To stop it, an earthworm scientist, his reporter ex-girlfriend, and other unlikely heroes team up to save their city.

23.name: The Parent Trap
23.description: Identical twins Annie and Hallie, separated at birth and each raised by one of their biological parents, later discover each other for the first time at summer camp and make a plan to bring their wayward parents back together.

24.name: The Mask of Zorro
24.description: A young thief, seeking revenge for the death of his brother, is trained by the once great, but aged Zorro, who also pursues vengeance of his own.

25.name: Practical Magic
25.description: Two witch sisters, raised by their eccentric aunts in a small town, face closed-minded prejudice and a curse which threatens to prevent them ever finding lasting love.

26.name: Dark City
26.description: A man struggles with memories of his past, which includes a wife he cannot remember, and a nightmarish world without a sun.

27.name: Small Soldiers
27.description: When missile technology is used to enhance toy action figures, the toys soon begin to take their battle programming too seriously.

28.name: Patch Adams
28.description: The true story of a heroic man, Hunter "Patch" Adams, determined to become a medical doctor because he enjoys helping people. He ventured where no doctor had ventured before, using humour and pathos.

29.name: Shakespeare in Love
29.description: A young Shakespeare, out of ideas and short of cash, meets his ideal woman and is inspired to write one of his most famous plays.

30.name: The Object of My Affection
30.description: A pregnant New York City social worker begins to develop romantic feelings for her gay best friend, and decides she'd rather raise her child with him, much to the dismay of her overbearing boyfriend.

31.name: Blues Brothers 2000
31.description: Elwood must reunite the old band, with a few new members, and go on another "Mission from God."

32.name: The Faculty
32.description: Students suspect that their teachers are aliens after bizarre occurrences.

33.name: Psycho
33.description: A young female embezzler arrives at the Bates Motel, which has terrible secrets of its own.

34.name: Rushmore
34.description: The extracurricular king of Rushmore Preparatory School is put on academic probation.

35.name: Half Baked
35.description: The story of three not so bright men who come up with a series of crazy schemes to get a friend out of jail.

36.name: The Prince of Egypt
36.description: An Egyptian prince learns of his identity as a Hebrew and his destiny to become the chosen deliverer of his people.

37.name: Can't Hardly Wait
37.description: Multicharacter teenage comedy about high school graduates with different agenda of life on graduation night.

38.name: Out of Sight
38.description: A career bank robber breaks out of jail, and shares a moment of mutual attraction with a U.S. Marshal he has kidnapped.

39.name: Lost in Space
39.description: The Robinson family was going into space to fight for a chance for humanity. Now they are fighting to live long enough to find a way home.

40.name: Great Expectations
40.description: Modernization of Charles Dickens classic story finds the hapless Finn as a painter in New York City pursuing his unrequited and haughty childhood love.

41.name: You've Got Mail
41.description: Two business rivals who despise each other in real life unwittingly fall in love over the Internet.

42.name: Mercury Rising
42.description: Shadowy elements in the NSA target a nine-year old autistic savant for death when he is able to decipher a top secret code.

43.name: Elizabeth
43.description: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

44.name: Pleasantville
44.description: Two 1990s teenage siblings find themselves in a 1950s sitcom, where their influence begins to profoundly change that complacent world.

45.name: Enemy of the State
45.description: A lawyer becomes a target by a corrupt politician and his N.S.A. goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a serious politically motivated crime.

46.name: What Dreams May Come
46.description: Chris Nielsen dies in car crash one night, and then goes to Heaven. Later, his widow Annie commits suicide, unable to overcome her loss. Chris descends into Hell to save her.

47.name: Deep Rising
47.description: A group of heavily armed hijackers board a luxury ocean liner in the South Pacific Ocean to loot it, only to do battle with a series of large-sized, tentacled, man-eating sea creatures who had already invaded the ship.

48.name: Sliding Doors
48.description: A London woman's love life and career both hinge, unknown to her, on whether or not she catches a train. We see it both ways, in parallel.

49.name: BASEketball
49.description: Two childhood friends are pro athletes of a national sport called BASEketball, a hybrid of baseball and basketball, and must deal with a greedy businessman scheming against their team.

50.name: Fallen
50.description: Homicide detective John Hobbes witnesses the execution of serial killer Edgar Reese. Soon after the execution the killings start again, and they are very similar to Reese's style.
